712290f-b.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712290f-b.text:
view 1: East 36th Street, e. fr. Second Avenue, showing
change in road level because of construction of
Vueens Midtown Iunnel.
Neg. no. A-1307
view 2: North from E. 36th Street on new road between
First and Second Avenues. Note change in street
level along E. 37th Street as result ofconstruc-
tion of Lueens Midtown unnel.

712303f-b.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712303f-b.text:
East 36th Street, north side, east of Second
Avenue (foreground), showing demolition for the pla2a
approach to the Midtown Gueens tunnel.
Standing intact in all views is the St. Gabriel's
branch of the New York Public Library. This is the last of
the builonga re.aining on the ''plaza'' and it too will be
razed in early 1940.
Adjoining same and partially destroyed in the
early views are St. Gabriel's HLall and Parochial School.
To the extreme right appear buiidings on the
east side of First Avenue, between 36th and 37th Streets.
Views 1-2 May 26, 1939
View 3 June 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPPODUCTIONS

707836f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707836f-a.text:
Second Avenue, at the N. E. corner of E. 36th Street,
showing clearance for the Oueens Midtown Tunnel. The sole
remaining structure at this date is the St. Gabriel's Branch
of the New York Public Library and which is shortly to be
demolished.
September 20, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library
MAY BE REPRODUCED

712305f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712305f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, east from Second Avenue, showing mainly the
northwesterly corner of St. Gabriel's Park, viewed southwestward.
Across same appears the New York Steam Go. plant (First Avenue)
and buildings on the south side of E. 35th Street. To the left is
St. Gabriel's zarochial School and a row of tenements, all of which
are to be deriolished for the 38th Street tunnel approach.
January 8, 1939
Sorach Photo 9ervice

March 27, 1938.

707840f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707840f-a.text:
Second Avenue, east side, IHOrth from East 36th
Street, showing the cleared area extending to 37th Street.
This is to be excavated for the approach to the new Midtown-
MQueens Tunnel.
Note the clearance at the far corner of 37th Street
which opens to v;ew the rears of tenenents that face on 38th
Strect. The 1d story apartment house, No. 3O1 East, is at
the H.E. corner of this thoroughfare. To the right is the
darlened side of tne New York Public Library branch. This
will be demolished in early 1940.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO EPR. DUCTIONS

shoing St. Gabriel's Hall prior to demolition. This is
sandwiched in between the branch of the New York Public Library

E. 37th Street. (W.v.)

712298f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712298f-a.text:
St. Gabriels Hall, w/ Eact 36th Street, north side,
east of Second Avenue, with part of the park in the
foreground. Ihis building is sandwiched between the St.
Sabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library
(at the left) and the parochial school (at the right).
March 23, 1928
P. L. Sperr, photographer

712299f-a.title: Manhattan: 36th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712299f-a.text:
301 to 337 East 36th Street (foreground), north side, east from Second
(left), to but not including First Aves., showing (left to right) the 4-
atory St. Gabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library (No. 303-305);
the Hall of St. Gabriel's (R.C.) Church (No. 307-309); and St. Gabriel's
Parochial School (No. 311-321). Also shown is a general view northward
from 317-323 East 34th Street, a 12-story loft building, with the News
Building (under construction ) on the south side of E. 42nd Street, between
Second and Third Avenues, and several units of Tudor City across the back-
ground.
September 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr. '
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707841f-c.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 36th St. E.
707841f-c.text:
Second Avenue, north from East 36th Street,
showing m.ainly the east side of this thoroughfare.
En the foreground, and extending to 37th Street
is a fenced clearance necessitated by the Miidtown-Quecns
Tunnel plaza approach. The remaining structure is the
St. Gabriels branch of the New York Public Library. This
is to come down early in 194O.
In the distance appears Tudor City. The apart-
ment structure on the Avenue, is at the N .E. corner of
3B8th Street. This bears No. 30l East 38th Street and was
constructed in 1930.
May 26, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr
